overview.title: About Pressure Converter
overview.content: Our pressure converter allows you to quickly and accurately convert between different pressure measurement units. Supports all major units: Pascals, atmospheres, and millimeters of mercury.

calculation.title: How Conversion Works
calculation.content: All pressure units are converted through the base unit - Pascal. Each unit has its own conversion formula, ensuring calculation accuracy.

units.title: Supported Units
units.content: The converter supports 3 main pressure units: Pascals (Pa), atmospheres (atm), and millimeters of mercury (mmHg).

advantages.title: Advantages of Our Converter
advantages.content: Accurate calculations, instant conversion, 4 languages support, user-friendly interface, mobile version.

faqItems.q: How to convert Pascals to atmospheres?
faqItems.a: Divide Pascals by 101325 to get atmospheres. For example: 101325 Pa = 101325 √∑ 101325 = 1 atm.

faqItems.q: How to convert mmHg to Pascals?
faqItems.a: Multiply mmHg by 133.322 to get Pascals. For example: 760 mmHg = 760 √ó 133.322 = 101325 Pa.

faqItems.q: How to convert atmospheres to mmHg?
faqItems.a: Multiply atmospheres by 760 to get mmHg. For example: 1 atm = 1 √ó 760 = 760 mmHg.
Standard atmospheric pressure is 101325 Pa (1 atm or 760 mmHg) at sea level at 0¬∞C temperature.
